Coding Resources For Learning JavaScript

Download and Use:

  • Atom (Code Editor)
  • Node JS (You can run JS in the terminal or on the server)
  • iTerm (A better terminal - you can have dropdown)

Learning Resources (in order)

  • W3Schools (Basic JS) (Sections: tutorial, objects, functions, DOM, JSON)
  • MDN Tutorial (Intermediate JS) (Learn this while trying problems from CtCI)
  • Cracking the Coding Interview (Book) (What you’d be expected to know minimum)
    • Github JS Solution Repo
  • Learn about Pointers from articles like this (C language)
  • You Don’t Know JS (Advanced understanding of JS) (optional)

Main Resources (for reference)

  • My JS Interview Prep (with Data Structures and Algorithms)
  • Awesome JS (Entry point for everything coding)

Tutorials

  • Awesome JS Learning Repo
  • Free code camp
  • Code academy

Things to learn later to be familiar with the JS ecosystem

  • *NPM (Node Package Manager)
  • *ESLint (QA Tool)
  • *ES6 (New helpful syntax)
  • Testing
    • *Mocha (Testing Framework - runs your tests)
    • *Chai (Assertions - the language of tests)
    • Travis CI (Continuous Integration - tests on the cloud)
    • Istanbul (Code Coverage - makes sure you tested everything)
    • CodeCov (Tests Istanbul in the cloud)

Other Resources

  • The State of JS
  • facebook-official
  • linkedin-square
  • instagram
  • github
